page.title: 01Crofting community Caolas
page.content: Caolas is a crofting area typical today of dying crofting community. Crofts are mainly used for grazing sheep and cattle with little crops grown. The village houses mostly occupied by elderly people are maintained to high standard. Coastline fishing is evident in a very smallway by local crofters. 'Acairseid an Duin' is the port for the offshore commercial shell fishing trade comprising mainly lobsters and prawns The harbour which has been subject to tidal conditions is presently undergoing extensive improvement, to facilitate easy access at all times.
